page.title: 14Thurlow's social clubs
page.content: A Brownie pack meets in the village, but Guides has folded up and Cubs and Scouts meet at Stetchworth and Stradishall. The mother and toddler group has enjoyed renewed success with 20 or so young mums. There is a strong Mothers Union whose monthly afternoon meetings include a religious service and a speaker. The lively W I meets monthly in the evening with cookery and craft competitions, entertainment and speakers, and maintains links with other village WIs. A surprising lack in this village is an over 60s club, so popular in other villages. However Thurlow's older residents seem to have themselves well enough organised and cared for without one. Attempts to start a youth club have also failed. The British Legion & Order of Buffaloes have branches here.
